definition: strict, thorough, and demanding
sentence: The rigorous training program prepared athletes for Olympic competition.

definition: kind and harmless
sentence: The doctor said the growth was benign, so Mia could relax.

definition: not well known or hard to understand
sentence: The ancient map used obscure symbols that took hours to decode.

definition: friendly and pleasant
sentence: Even on Mondays, Mr. Lee was so amiable that students wanted to talk to him.

definition: honest and straightforward
sentence: When asked about the messy room, Jamal gave a candid answer instead of making excuses.

definition: careful about spending money; saving
sentence: Because she was frugal, Maya repaired her sneakers instead of buying new ones.

definition: tired, sluggish, or lacking energy
sentence: After the movie marathon, Leo felt too lethargic to finish his homework.

definition: very careful and paying great attention to details
sentence: The model was so meticulous that every tiny paint stroke matched the real building.

definition: a person new to something; a beginner
sentence: As a novice skateboarder, Priya practiced the basic moves in the empty parking lot.

definition: showing careful good judgment; cautious
sentence: Being prudent, Sam checked the weather before deciding to bike to school.

definition: more than enough; plentiful
sentence: After the storm, the garden produced an abundant supply of tomatoes.

definition: hard to understand; complex
sentence: The teacher tried to explain the abstruse theory with a simple diagram.

definition: an award or praise for achievement
sentence: Receiving the accolade for her art project made Ana beam with pride.

definition: to accept or agree without protest
sentence: Although he had doubts, Marco decided to acquiesce to the plan.

definition: having a strong, unpleasant smell or taste; sharp in manner
sentence: The acrid smoke made everyone leave the kitchen quickly.

definition: very skilled at something
sentence: Nina is adept at solving puzzles and rarely gets stuck.

definition: to warn or scold gently
sentence: The coach had to admonish the players for being late to practice.

definition: to make something poorer in quality by adding inferior substances
sentence: They were fined for trying to adulterate the juice with cheaper syrup.

definition: serious trouble or difficulty
sentence: Even in the face of adversity, she kept working toward her goals.

definition: to support or argue for something; a person who supports a cause
sentence: He decided to advocate for later school start times after reading the studies.

definition: pleasant and easy to talk to
sentence: Our new neighbor is so affable that everyone stops to chat.

definition: to increase in power, influence, or reputation
sentence: The celebrity tried to aggrandize his role in the movie during interviews.

definition: eagerness or quick willingness
sentence: She accepted the invitation with alacrity and started planning immediately.

definition: to make something less severe or painful
sentence: A warm bath helped alleviate his sore muscles after the game.

definition: to improve or make better
sentence: Volunteering helped ameliorate the neighborhood park’s condition.

definition: having more than one possible meaning; unclear
sentence: The message was ambiguous, so we weren’t sure what time to meet.

definition: something that is unusual or unexpected
sentence: The glowing plant was an anomaly that puzzled the scientists.

definition: to make someone hostile or angry
sentence: Try not to antagonize your little brother when he’s already upset.

definition: a strong feeling of dislike
sentence: Her antipathy toward broccoli meant she avoided it at dinner.

definition: to calm or satisfy someone by giving in to their demands
sentence: To appease the class, the teacher extended the project deadline.

definition: based on random choice rather than reason
sentence: The seating chart seemed arbitrary, and no one knew why seats were chosen.

definition: very dry; lacking moisture
sentence: Cacti thrive in arid climates where most plants cannot grow.

definition: able to express ideas clearly in speech or writing
sentence: She was able to articulate her ideas during the debate with confidence.

definition: to move upward or rise
sentence: The hikers began to ascend the steep trail at dawn.

definition: to find out or learn with certainty
sentence: The detective worked to ascertain the time of the accident.

definition: to make less severe; to ease or calm
sentence: A kind note helped assuage his worries before the test.

definition: very bold or daring
sentence: Her audacious idea surprised everyone but worked brilliantly.

definition: to make larger or increase
sentence: They augmented the team with two new players before the tournament.

definition: showing signs that something will be successful; favorable
sentence: The sunny weather was an auspicious start to the picnic.

definition: simple and without decoration; strict or serious
sentence: The old house had an austere look, with plain walls and few furnishings.

definition: independence; freedom to make your own choices
sentence: Teenagers often seek more autonomy as they grow older.

definition: extreme greed for wealth or material gain
sentence: His avarice made him keep all the treasure for himself.

definition: so lacking in originality as to be obvious and boring
sentence: The movie’s plot was so banal that many people left early.

definition: a cause of great trouble or annoyance
sentence: Mosquitoes were the bane of their camping trip.

definition: kind and wanting to help others
sentence: The benevolent group donated books to the school library.

definition: to support or strengthen
sentence: Her notes helped bolster his understanding before the exam.

definition: noisy, energetic, and cheerful in a rough way
sentence: The boisterous crowd cheered loudly at the concert.

definition: shortness in time or words; being brief
sentence: The teacher appreciated the brevity of his clear presentation.

definition: growing or expanding rapidly
sentence: The burgeoning tech club attracted many new members this year.

definition: to persuade someone with flattery or gentle urging
sentence: She tried to cajole her parents into letting her go to the party.

definition: a disaster or terrible event causing great damage or distress
sentence: The flood was a calamity that affected the entire town.

definition: the quality of being honest and straightforward
sentence: I admired his candor when he admitted his mistake.

definition: changing suddenly in mood or behavior; unpredictable
sentence: The weather here is capricious — sunny one hour and stormy the next.

definition: able to burn or corrode, or sharply critical or sarcastic
sentence: Her caustic remark stung him more than she expected.

definition: to express strong disapproval of someone or something
sentence: The committee chose to censure the player for cheating.

definition: a person who pretends to have skills or knowledge they do not have
sentence: The so-called expert turned out to be a charlatan who sold fake remedies.

definition: to scold or punish severely
sentence: The principal had to chastise students who vandalized the walls.

definition: completely disordered and unpredictable
sentence: The classroom became chaotic when the substitute left for a moment.

definition: lasting a long time or recurring often
sentence: He suffered from chronic headaches that needed treatment.

definition: kept secret, especially because it is illicit
sentence: They held clandestine meetings to plan the surprise party.

definition: mercy or leniency shown toward someone
sentence: The judge showed clemency because the mistake was minor and unintentional.

definition: clear and logical; easy to understand
sentence: Her presentation was coherent and moved smoothly from point to point.

definition: used in ordinary or familiar conversation rather than formal speech
sentence: The essay was fine but a bit too colloquial for a formal assignment.

definition: equal in measure or proportion; corresponding in size or degree
sentence: The prize was commensurate with the effort the team put in.

definition: self-satisfied and unconcerned with possible problems
sentence: After winning a few games, the team became complacent and stopped practicing.

definition: involved with others in wrongdoing
sentence: He was complicit in hiding the truth, so he received part of the blame.

definition: using few words; clear and brief
sentence: Her concise instructions helped everyone complete the assignment quickly.

definition: to create or invent, especially a story or plan
sentence: They concocted a funny tale to explain why they were late.

definition: to agree with someone or something
sentence: All the teachers concur that the project was a success.

definition: having a superior attitude toward others; patronizing
sentence: His condescending tone made the students feel small.

definition: to accept or allow behavior that is wrong
sentence: Parents should not condone cheating on tests.

definition: pleasant because of a personality or interests similar to one’s own
sentence: The club was congenial, and she made friends easily there.

definition: an opinion or conclusion formed without all the facts; a guess
sentence: His theory was interesting but mostly conjecture without the data.

definition: to secretly cooperate in wrongdoing or to allow it to happen
sentence: They seemed to connive to skip class and blame it on traffic.

definition: easily seen or noticed; obvious
sentence: Her bright jacket made her conspicuous in the crowd.

definition: a confusing and difficult problem or question
sentence: The riddle was a real conundrum that puzzled everyone.

definition: general agreement among a group
sentence: After long discussion, the class reached a consensus about the field trip.

definition: to limit or restrict someone’s actions or freedom
sentence: Rules can constrain how students choose their projects.

definition: causing or likely to cause disagreement; argumentative
sentence: The debate became contentious when people started shouting.

definition: to plan cleverly or invent a scheme
sentence: They contrived a way to finish the project faster.

definition: feeling or showing regret for wrongdoing
sentence: He wrote a contrite apology after breaking her favorite mug.

definition: abundant in supply or quantity
sentence: She took copious notes during the lecture to study later.

definition: to confirm or give support to a statement or idea
sentence: The video helped corroborate his version of the events.

definition: too ready to believe things; gullible
sentence: The advertisement tricked credulous shoppers into buying the fake product.

definition: mysterious or having a hidden meaning
sentence: The teacher left a cryptic hint about the test that confused everyone.

definition: done quickly with little attention to detail
sentence: His cursory review missed several important mistakes in the paper.

definition: to make someone feel intimidated or apprehensive
sentence: The big project did not daunt her; she started right away.

definition: a sudden and complete failure or collapse
sentence: The surprise party turned into a debacle when the lights went out.

definition: to weaken or make someone less effective
sentence: The illness could debilitate even strong athletes for weeks.

definition: moral or cultural decline characterized by excessive indulgence
sentence: Some novels describe a city’s decadence before it fell into ruin.

definition: proper behavior and manners in public
sentence: Students were expected to show decorum during the assembly.

definition: respectful submission or yielding to another’s opinion
sentence: Out of deference to the older students, they waited until they spoke.

definition: to describe or portray something precisely
sentence: The map clearly delineated the park’s walking trails.

definition: harmful or damaging
sentence: The chemical proved deleterious to the plants in the garden.

definition: to lower in dignity or make someone feel worse
sentence: It’s wrong to demean others because of differences.

definition: quiet, serious, and modest in behavior
sentence: At the recital she was demure and focused on her playing.

definition: to publicly declare something to be wrong or evil
sentence: The mayor denounced the vandalism and promised action.

definition: to show or describe something in words or pictures
sentence: The book vividly depicts life in the old city.

definition: to use up or reduce the amount of something
sentence: Overfishing may deplete the lake’s supply of fish.

definition: to express disapproval of someone or something
sentence: He tended to deprecate his own work even when others praised it.

definition: to laugh at or insult someone in a cruel way
sentence: They would deride the new idea until they actually tried it.

definition: empty, lonely, and depressing; devastated
sentence: After the festival ended, the fairgrounds looked desolate.

definition: very sad and without hope
sentence: She felt despondent after failing the big test, but friends cheered her up.

definition: something that discourages or prevents an action
sentence: A strong alarm system acts as a deterrent to thieves.

definition: hardworking and careful in doing tasks
sentence: The diligent student reviewed her notes every night.

definition: very small in size
sentence: The diminutive puppy fit into the small backpack comfortably.

definition: showing good judgment and understanding
sentence: A discerning reader could spot the author’s message quickly.

definition: disagreement or lack of harmony among people
sentence: There was discord in the group about how to spend the prize money.

definition: a difference between two things that should match
sentence: The accountant found a discrepancy in the numbers and double-checked the report.

definition: a feeling that someone or something is unworthy of respect
sentence: She showed disdain for the idea without listening to the reasons.

definition: very poor or gloomy; depressing
sentence: The team had a dismal performance in the championship game.

definition: to speak about someone in a negative way; belittle
sentence: It’s unfair to disparage someone’s effort when they tried their best.

definition: a noticeable difference between two things
sentence: There is often a disparity between what people say and what they do.

definition: to spread information or ideas widely
sentence: The club used posters to disseminate news about the bake sale.

definition: to disagree with a common opinion or decision
sentence: A few students dissent from the popular view and explain why.

definition: easily taught or controlled; gentle
sentence: The new puppy was surprisingly docile during training.

definition: strongly expressing beliefs as if they are facts
sentence: He was dogmatic about his method even though others had good ideas.

definition: inactive but able to become active later
sentence: The volcano has been dormant for decades but is still watched closely.

definition: doubtful or uncertain; causing doubt
sentence: Her explanation sounded dubious, so the teacher asked for proof.

definition: expressing ideas clearly and effectively in speech or writing
sentence: His eloquent speech convinced many people to volunteer.

definition: difficult to find, catch, or understand
sentence: The solution to the puzzle remained elusive despite many attempts.

definition: to add details to make something more attractive or interesting
sentence: She would embellish her stories to make them more exciting.

definition: to accept something willingly or hug someone
sentence: They decided to embrace the new rules after discussing them.

definition: to come into view or become known
sentence: A pattern began to emerge after analyzing all the data.

definition: to imitate someone admired in order to equal or excel them
sentence: She tried to emulate her older sister’s study habits to improve her grades.

definition: a person or thing that is mysterious or puzzling
sentence: The old mansion was an enigma that attracted curious visitors.

definition: deep hatred or hostility between people
sentence: Longstanding enmity between the teams made the game intense.

definition: lasting a very short time
sentence: The beauty of the sunset felt ephemeral but unforgettable.

definition: a perfect example of a particular quality
sentence: She was the epitome of kindness during the charity drive.

definition: fair and impartial; just
sentence: The teacher tried to make the grading system equitable for everyone.

definition: not regular or predictable in movement or behavior
sentence: His erratic attendance worried his counselor.

definition: having or showing great knowledge; learned
sentence: The erudite professor answered every question with clear facts.

definition: a mild or indirect word used instead of a harsh one
sentence: Saying someone 'passed away' is a euphemism for saying they died.

definition: very happy or excited
sentence: They felt euphoric after winning the championship.

definition: trying to avoid giving a direct answer or committing
sentence: His evasive answers made the teacher suspicious about the missing book.

definition: to make a problem or situation worse
sentence: Arguing in public will only exacerbate their disagreement.

definition: to show that someone is not guilty of wrongdoing
sentence: New evidence might exculpate the defendant from the accusation.

definition: to strongly encourage or urge someone to do something
sentence: Her coach would exhort the team to give one more push in the final quarter.

definition: to make something happen sooner or faster
sentence: They paid extra to expedite the shipping of the textbooks.

definition: a quick or practical solution that may not be fair or moral
sentence: Choosing the expedient response solved the problem but upset some people.

definition: filled with lively energy and excitement
sentence: The children were exuberant on the last day of school.

definition: treating serious issues with inappropriate humor
sentence: His facetious comment about homework didn’t sit well with the principal.

definition: to make a process easier or smoother
sentence: The new software will facilitate collaboration among team members.

definition: based on a mistaken belief or unsound reasoning
sentence: The argument fell apart once the fallacious idea was exposed.

definition: very attentive to detail; hard to please
sentence: She was fastidious about keeping her desk clean and organized.

definition: destined to happen; certain by fate
sentence: They joked that meeting in the café was fated after so many coincidences.

definition: intense and passionate feeling
sentence: The fans cheered with fervor when their team scored.

definition: changing frequently in loyalty or interest
sentence: Customers are fickle and might change brands quickly.

definition: excessively ornate or flowery in style
sentence: The novel’s florid descriptions sometimes made it slow to read.

definition: to change or vary often by rising and falling
sentence: Temperatures may fluctuate wildly in springtime.

definition: patience and self-control when faced with trouble
sentence: With great forbearance, she waited her turn without complaint.

definition: to predict or indicate a future misfortune; to foretell
sentence: The dark clouds seemed to forebode a storm.

definition: to form or make something, often with effort; also to fake
sentence: They decided to forge a friendship after months of cooperating.

definition: inspiring fear or respect because of size or power
sentence: Facing a formidable opponent, the team trained harder than ever.

definition: happening by a lucky chance; fortunate
sentence: It was fortuitous that they found the lost ring on the sidewalk.

definition: filled with something negative like worry or danger
sentence: The journey was fraught with challenges, but they finished it.

definition: done secretly to avoid notice
sentence: He cast a furtive glance at the answers on the desk beside him.

definition: enjoying the company of others; sociable
sentence: Her gregarious nature made her the center of many parties.

definition: a complaint about a wrong or unfair situation
sentence: The students filed a grievance about the cafeteria food.

definition: clever but dishonest behavior used to deceive
sentence: The con artist used guile to steal valuables from the tourists.

definition: done in a random or disorganized way
sentence: The decorations looked haphazard because they were put up at the last minute.

definition: a sign that something will happen soon
sentence: Falling leaves can be a harbinger of colder weather.

definition: to make something happen sooner or move quickly
sentence: They had to hasten their steps to catch the last bus.

definition: someone who seeks pleasure as their main goal
sentence: A hedonist might choose fun activities over chores every time.

definition: to create difficulties that make something slower or harder
sentence: Heavy rain would hinder the outdoor match from being played.

definition: made up of parts that are the same or similar
sentence: The field of wheat looked homogeneous from a distance.

definition: based on a suggested idea or theory rather than actual fact
sentence: In the debate, they discussed a hypothetical situation to test their ideas.

definition: a strange or unusual habit that is unique to a person
sentence: One idiosyncrasy of Mr. Park is that he taps his pen when thinking.

definition: to explain or make something clear by giving examples or pictures
sentence: The teacher used a cartoon to illustrate the difficult concept.

definition: about to happen very soon
sentence: Dark clouds and thunder made an imminent storm likely.

definition: fair and not taking sides
sentence: A judge must remain impartial and base decisions on facts.

definition: a situation where no progress is possible; a deadlock
sentence: Negotiations reached an impasse when both sides refused to budge.

definition: to slow or block progress
sentence: The fallen tree might impede the cars on the road until crews remove it.

definition: perfect and without any faults
sentence: Her attendance record was impeccable all year.

definition: unable to be calmed or satisfied; unforgiving
sentence: The coach seemed implacable after the team’s repeated mistakes.

definition: a possible result or effect, or a suggestion indirectly made
sentence: The implication of skipping school could be missing important lessons.

definition: implied though not plainly expressed; understood without being stated
sentence: There was an implicit agreement that everyone would bring snacks.

definition: to make poor or reduce the quality of something
sentence: Overuse of the soil can impoverish the land and reduce crops.

definition: done without being planned or rehearsed; spontaneous
sentence: They gave an impromptu performance in the cafeteria that surprised everyone.

definition: rude or disrespectfully bold
sentence: It was impudent of him to interrupt the speaker so loudly.

definition: not done on purpose; accidental
sentence: She made an inadvertent error on the form and corrected it quickly.

definition: silly or stupid; lacking sense
sentence: They laughed at the inane joke even though it made little sense.

definition: never stopping; continuous
sentence: The incessant noise from construction made it hard to study.

definition: showing clear thinking and good judgment; sharp
sentence: Her incisive comments improved the whole discussion.

definition: not logically connected; hard to understand
sentence: After being so tired, his explanation became incoherent and jumbled.

definition: incapable of being corrected or reformed
sentence: The prankster seemed incorrigible despite many warnings.

definition: feeling anger because of unfair treatment
sentence: She was indignant when falsely accused of cheating.

definition: done without careful judgment or choice
sentence: An indiscriminate selection of colors made the painting look messy.

definition: not producing the desired effect; weak
sentence: His ineffectual attempt to fix the bike left it worse than before.

definition: to hold back or prevent someone from doing something
sentence: Shyness can inhibit students from speaking up in class.

definition: natural or inborn; existing from birth
sentence: Her innate musical talent became obvious at an early age.

definition: to introduce new ideas or methods
sentence: The team tried to innovate a faster way to charge laptops.

definition: impossible to satisfy; always wanting more
sentence: His insatiable curiosity led him to read every book in the library.

definition: narrow-minded or isolated from outside influences
sentence: The community’s insular attitude made it hard to accept new ideas.

definition: very brave and unafraid of danger
sentence: The intrepid explorer climbed cliffs most people avoided.

definition: to arouse interest or curiosity; a secret plot
sentence: The mysterious clue helped to intrigue the readers of the story.

definition: to flood or overwhelm by too much of something
sentence: After the announcement, the club was inundated with new members.

definition: insulting or abusive language used to attack someone
sentence: The online discussion descended into invective rather than debate.

definition: quickly angered; easily made angry
sentence: His irascible coach shouted at mistakes during practice.

definition: when something happens in a way opposite to what is expected, often amusingly so
sentence: It was ironic that the fire station burned down due to a small electrical fire.

definition: tired or bored because of too much of something
sentence: After watching so many movies, he felt jaded and wanted a new activity.

definition: special words used by a particular group or profession
sentence: The doctor’s jargon confused the family until someone explained it plainly.

definition: cheerful and friendly
sentence: Her jovial laugh made the whole classroom smile.

definition: extremely happy and joyful
sentence: The team was jubilant after winning the championship.

definition: a particular point in time or where things join
sentence: At this crucial juncture, the group decided to change plans.

definition: to place side by side for comparison
sentence: The artist chose to juxtapose bright and dark colors for contrast.

definition: the central or most important part
sentence: The kernel of his idea was simple but clever.

definition: knowledge or understanding
sentence: Gardening is outside my ken, so I asked for advice.

definition: praise or honor for an achievement
sentence: Kudos to Mira for organizing the fundraiser so well.

definition: using very few words; brief
sentence: His laconic reply made everyone wonder what he really thought.

definition: to express sadness or regret
sentence: They lamented the loss of the old playground after it was removed.

definition: very generous or extravagant
sentence: The party was lavish, with decorations everywhere and a big cake.

definition: not strict or careful enough
sentence: The school’s lax rules allowed students to use phones during lunch.

definition: cautious or suspicious about something
sentence: I’m leery of taking advice from someone I just met online.

definition: something handed down from the past, like traditions or money
sentence: Her grandmother left a legacy of kindness and family recipes.

definition: clear enough to read
sentence: Please write neatly so your notes are legible to everyone.

definition: able to cause death or very harmful
sentence: Some chemicals are lethal and must be handled with care.

definition: tired and lacking energy
sentence: The heat made the students feel lethargic during afternoon classes.

definition: a false written statement that harms someone’s reputation
sentence: Publishing lies about someone can result in a libel lawsuit.

definition: generous or open-minded; not strict
sentence: The school took a liberal approach to helping students who needed time.

definition: a band of tissue that connects bones or holds organs in place
sentence: The athlete injured a ligament in her knee during the game.

definition: clear and easy to understand; transparent
sentence: His explanation was limpid, so everyone understood the plan.

definition: moving gracefully and easily
sentence: The dancer’s lithe movements earned her a standing ovation.

definition: clear and easy to understand
sentence: He gave a lucid account of what happened at the event.

definition: ridiculous and unreasonable; silly
sentence: The idea of a flying bicycle sounded ludicrous at first.

definition: very sad or gloomy in an exaggerated way
sentence: The foggy weather made the town look lugubrious and quiet.

definition: very vivid in a shocking or unpleasant way
sentence: The newspaper printed a lurid description that upset readers.

definition: shiny and glowing
sentence: The new car had a lustrous finish that reflected the sun.

definition: very generous or forgiving toward others
sentence: Despite the loss, he was magnanimous and praised the winners.

definition: having or showing a wish to do evil to others
sentence: The villain in the story had a malevolent plan to take the throne.

definition: intended to harm or upset someone
sentence: Posting malicious comments online can hurt people’s feelings.

definition: an official order or command; to give authority to do something
sentence: The school issued a mandate that all students wear badges at events.

definition: clear or obvious to the mind; to show or reveal
sentence: Her talent for drawing was manifest from a young age.

definition: damaged or spoiled to some extent
sentence: The mural was marred by a few careless paint splashes.

definition: to wander slowly without a fixed direction
sentence: We meandered through the park enjoying the warm afternoon.

definition: a deep, long-lasting sadness
sentence: A feeling of melancholy settled over him after reading the sad letter.

definition: changing often and quickly in mood or behavior
sentence: Her mercurial temper made it hard to predict her reactions.

definition: working only for money, especially without loyalty
sentence: The mercenary soldier fought for whichever side paid him most.

definition: a complete change of form or character
sentence: The caterpillar’s metamorphosis into a butterfly amazed the class.

definition: courage and determination in a difficult situation
sentence: She showed her mettle by leading the rescue during the storm.

definition: to speak harmful untruths about someone; to slander
sentence: It’s wrong to malign others just to make yourself look better.

definition: able to be shaped or changed easily
sentence: Gold is malleable enough to be formed into thin sheets.

definition: relating to marriage
sentence: They attended a workshop that discussed marital communication skills.

definition: very small or insufficient in amount
sentence: The meager snack was not enough to keep them going until dinner.

definition: to help settle a disagreement between people
sentence: A counselor helped mediate the dispute between friends.

definition: excessively emotional or dramatic
sentence: Her melodramatic reaction made the small problem seem huge.

definition: an experienced person who advises or helps someone less experienced
sentence: The senior student acted as a mentor to the newcomers.

definition: showing kindness or forgiveness; merciful
sentence: The teacher was merciful when students forgot to bring homework once.

definition: careful and precise with details
sentence: She was meticulous in arranging the science fair displays.

definition: to make less severe or painful
sentence: A good explanation might mitigate the teacher’s disappointment.

definition: not thinking too highly of oneself; simple
sentence: Despite his success, he remained modest and kind to others.

definition: to calm someone down or reduce their anger
sentence: An apology helped mollify her anger after the argument.

definition: boring because of sameness; unchanging
sentence: The lecture became monotonous and several students nodded off.

definition: having an unhealthy interest in unpleasant subjects, especially death
sentence: His morbid fascination with horror stories made others uneasy.

definition: ordinary and not interesting; common
sentence: She wanted to escape her mundane chores with an exciting trip.

definition: likely to change; not constant
sentence: Human opinions can be mutable depending on new information.

definition: short-sighted; lacking imagination or foresight
sentence: Making decisions only for today can seem myopic in the long run.

definition: a very large number or many
sentence: There are a myriad of stars visible on a clear night.

definition: lacking experience or judgment; easily fooled
sentence: She was naive about online scams and nearly gave away personal info.

definition: having an excessive interest in oneself
sentence: He seemed narcissistic, always talking about his own achievements.

definition: vague, unclear, or ill-defined
sentence: His plan remained nebulous until he listed specific steps.

definition: so small or unimportant as to be not worth considering
sentence: The cost was negligible compared to the benefit it brought.

definition: favoritism shown to relatives or friends, usually in jobs
sentence: People criticized the company for hiring by nepotism instead of merit.

definition: quick and light in movement or thinking
sentence: Her nimble fingers fixed the broken toy in minutes.

definition: active at night
sentence: Owls are nocturnal birds that hunt when it’s dark.

definition: appearing calm and not showing worry or interest
sentence: He answered the question with a nonchalant shrug, as if it were no big deal.

definition: famous for something bad
sentence: The intersection is notorious for causing traffic jams.

definition: new and not like anything seen before
sentence: They tried a novel approach to solve the recycling problem.

definition: a small difference in meaning or feeling
sentence: She noticed a nuance in her friend’s tone that suggested worry.

definition: many; a lot of people or things
sentence: Numerous volunteers showed up to help clean the beach.

definition: the state of being forgotten or unknown
sentence: After the trend passed, the old song faded into oblivion.

definition: not aware of what is happening around one
sentence: Walking with headphones, she was oblivious to the rain starting.

definition: offensive to moral feelings or inappropriate
sentence: The movie received complaints because of some obscene language.

definition: too eager to help or obey someone important; overly flattering
sentence: His obsequious behavior toward the principal seemed fake to his classmates.

definition: stubborn and refusing to change opinion or action
sentence: The donkey remained obstinate and would not move forward.

definition: to block or close up
sentence: A blood clot can occlude an artery and cause serious harm.

definition: all-powerful; having unlimited power
sentence: In myths, gods are often shown as omnipotent beings.

definition: knowing everything; having complete knowledge
sentence: The narrator was omniscient and explained each character’s thoughts.

definition: burdensome or difficult to deal with
sentence: The regulations proved onerous for the small business to follow.

definition: not allowing light through; hard to understand
sentence: The glass was opaque, so we couldn’t see who was inside.

definition: happening at a good or useful time
sentence: Your call was opportune—just when I needed help.

definition: conventional or traditional in beliefs or methods
sentence: He preferred orthodox solutions rather than risky experiments.

definition: showy in a way meant to attract attention or impress others
sentence: Her ostentatious jewelry made her stand out at the simple party.

definition: to be too much to handle; to overpower
sentence: The sudden amount of homework would overwhelm any student.

definition: to combine with oxygen; to cause to rust or change chemically
sentence: If you leave the metal outside, it will oxidize and turn brown.

definition: to calm down or soothe someone who is angry or upset
sentence: A friendly apology helped pacify the upset customer.

definition: done with great care and attention to detail
sentence: Her painstaking study notes helped many classmates prepare for the exam.

definition: able to be felt or easily noticed
sentence: The excitement in the room was palpable before the concert.

definition: a statement that seems contradictory but might be true
sentence: It’s a paradox that sometimes being quiet helps you be heard more.

definition: a perfect example of a quality or model of excellence
sentence: She was a paragon of patience while helping her classmates.

definition: a person rejected and avoided by others
sentence: After the rumor spread, he felt like a pariah at school.

definition: strongly supporting a political party or cause; biased
sentence: The article seemed partisan and favored one side heavily.

definition: relating to the countryside or rural life
sentence: They enjoyed a pastoral walk through fields and farms.

definition: obvious or clear; also an official right to an invention
sentence: The mistake was patent to everyone after the test results came out.

definition: a strong liking or tendency for something
sentence: She has a penchant for sketching animals in her notebook.

definition: deeply or seriously thoughtful, often with sadness
sentence: He grew pensive while looking at old photographs.

definition: serious danger or risk
sentence: The hikers knew they faced peril if they continued without supplies.

definition: to spread throughout something
sentence: The smell of baking bread permeated the whole house.

definition: very harmful or destructive, often in a subtle way
sentence: The pernicious rumor damaged her reputation over time.

definition: to keep trying despite difficulties
sentence: She chose to persevere with math even when it was hard.

definition: to spread through every part of something
sentence: A feeling of excitement pervaded the stadium before the game.

definition: easily annoyed and irritable, especially over small things
sentence: The petulant child pouted when he couldn’t have extra dessert.

definition: an event or fact that can be observed and studied
sentence: The northern lights are a natural phenomenon that draws tourists.

definition: a sudden feeling of annoyance or interest
sentence: Her curiosity was piqued by the mysterious package on the doorstep.

definition: very important and central to the outcome
sentence: That exam was pivotal for deciding her final grade.

definition: to calm someone by giving in or apologizing
sentence: He tried to placate his friend after the argument.

definition: calm and peaceful
sentence: The placid lake reflected the clouds perfectly.

definition: seeming reasonable or likely to be true
sentence: Her explanation sounded plausible enough to convince the teacher.

definition: a strong written or spoken attack on someone or something
sentence: The essay became a polemic against unfair school policies.

definition: to think about something carefully
sentence: He would ponder the best answer before raising his hand.

definition: to be a sign that something momentous or bad will happen
sentence: The sudden drop in temperature seemed to portend a fierce storm.

definition: happening after a person’s death
sentence: The composer received a posthumous award for his work.

definition: to cause something to happen suddenly or sooner than expected
sentence: The announcement could precipitate a rush of applicants.

definition: to prevent something from happening; to make impossible
sentence: A closed door can preclude others from entering the room.

definition: a very steep cliff or dangerous situation
sentence: The hikers stood at the edge of a precipice and felt dizzy.

definition: honesty and strong moral principles
sentence: Her probity was clear when she returned the lost wallet untouched.

definition: to announce publicly or declare
sentence: The principal will proclaim the winners at the assembly.

definition: to delay doing something until later
sentence: Don’t procrastinate—start your project early to avoid stress.

definition: spending money or resources freely and wastefully
sentence: The prodigal prince spent his fortune on exotic parties.

definition: a young person with exceptional talents or abilities
sentence: The piano prodigy played a difficult concerto at only nine years old.

definition: showing disrespect for sacred things; vulgar
sentence: Using profane language in the chapel was not allowed.

definition: producing a lot; highly productive
sentence: The prolific author published three books last year.

definition: commonplace and dull; lacking imagination
sentence: His prosaic report failed to capture the class’s attention.

definition: to succeed or become wealthy and healthy
sentence: With good planning, the small business began to prosper.

definition: lasting for a long time or extended in duration
sentence: They faced a protracted dispute that lasted months.

definition: to cause a strong reaction or anger
sentence: Don’t provoke your sister when she’s studying for finals.

definition: a false name used by an author or person
sentence: The writer published the book under a pseudonym to stay anonymous.

definition: having a strong, sharp smell or taste; sharp in expression
sentence: The cheese had a pungent odor that filled the kitchen.

definition: to claim or appear to be something, often falsely
sentence: The message purported to be from the principal but was actually a joke.

definition: a place or state of suffering or waiting for purification
sentence: After exams, the students felt like they were in academic purgatory.

definition: a state of uncertainty or doubt about what to do
sentence: We were in a quandary about which route to take home.

definition: to put an end to something, especially by force or authority
sentence: The teacher had to quell the noisy argument before class continued.

definition: representing the most perfect example of something
sentence: She is the quintessential student—polite, curious, and hardworking.

definition: inactive or resting; quiet
sentence: The volcano has been quiescent for many years.

definition: a strange habit or peculiar trait
sentence: One quirky habit of his is collecting odd-shaped rocks.

definition: unrealistic and impractical but romantic or noble
sentence: His quixotic plan to travel the world with no money sounded risky.

definition: everyday or ordinary; commonplace
sentence: She wrote in her diary about quotidian details of school life.

definition: extremely hungry
sentence: After practice he was ravenous and ate two sandwiches.

definition: stubbornly refusing to obey or follow orders
sentence: The recalcitrant student refused to hand in his project.

definition: to withdraw or take back a statement or belief
sentence: Under pressure, he had to recant his earlier claim.

definition: a person who lives alone and avoids others
sentence: The famous actor became a recluse and rarely left his home.

definition: to restore friendly relations between people
sentence: They tried to reconcile after the misunderstanding.

definition: strongly reminiscent of something; fragrant
sentence: The kitchen was redolent with the scent of fresh bread.

definition: unnecessary because it repeats something else
sentence: The teacher removed redundant sentences to make the essay clearer.

definition: to prove that a statement or argument is false
sentence: He used data to refute the mistaken belief about the experiment.

definition: to assign to a lower position or place
sentence: They threatened to relegate the team to the second division after poor performance.

definition: deep regret for wrongdoing or a mistake
sentence: He felt genuine remorse after breaking his friend’s model airplane.

definition: famous and respected for achievements
sentence: The scientist became renowned for her important discoveries.

definition: an exact copy or reproduction
sentence: The museum displayed a replica of the ancient statue for students to study.

definition: able to recover quickly from difficulties or changes
sentence: After the loss, the team proved resilient and came back stronger.

definition: not revealing one’s thoughts or feelings readily; reserved
sentence: Though shy, he was not rude—just reticent in groups.

definition: stiff and not easily changed or bent
sentence: The rules were rigid and left no room for exceptions.

definition: competition between people or groups for the same goal
sentence: A friendly rivalry between the schools pushed both teams to improve.

definition: basic or simple; not fully developed
sentence: They used rudimentary tools to build the small bridge.

definition: pretending to be morally better than others
sentence: His sanctimonious lecture annoyed classmates who knew his record.

definition: optimistic or positive, especially in a difficult situation
sentence: She remained sanguine about passing the test despite the hard material.

definition: mocking or cynical in a scornful way
sentence: His sardonically phrased comment hurt her feelings.

definition: having practical knowledge or cleverness
sentence: The savvy student knew how to find reliable sources for projects.

definition: sparkling or brilliant in conversation or performance
sentence: Her scintillating commentary made the lecture enjoyable.

definition: very careful to do what is morally right; honest
sentence: He was scrupulous about citing every source in his report.

definition: to examine something carefully and closely
sentence: The scientist had to scrutinize the samples under a microscope.

definition: finding something good by chance
sentence: By serendipity, they found a lost bracelet while gardening.

definition: excessively obedient or eager to please
sentence: His servile behavior toward authority annoyed his classmates.

definition: to cut off or separate by cutting
sentence: The rescue team had to sever the tangled ropes to free the climber.

definition: having doubts or not easily convinced
sentence: She was skeptical of the rumor until she saw proof.

definition: a false spoken statement that harms someone’s reputation
sentence: Spreading slander about classmates can cause serious trouble.

definition: messy and careless in appearance or work
sentence: His slovenly desk made it hard to find his homework.

definition: immature or overconfident; juvenile behavior
sentence: His sophomoric prank embarrassed the whole class.

definition: done suddenly without planning or premeditation
sentence: They gave a spontaneous performance that delighted the crowd.

definition: serious and strict in manner
sentence: The coach’s stern look stopped the noisy crowd immediately.

definition: to provide evidence to support or prove something
sentence: Can you substantiate your claim with facts or data?

definition: not obvious; slight and hard to notice
sentence: She used subtle hints to show she needed help without asking outright.

definition: silent and gloomy because of anger or sadness
sentence: He sat in a sullen mood after losing the match.

definition: rich and expensive-looking
sentence: The banquet featured sumptuous foods and elegant decorations.

definition: to take the place of something or someone else
sentence: New technology may supplant older methods of communication.

definition: to ask humbly and earnestly; to beg
sentence: They would supplicate the teacher for extra credit after the exam.

definition: to overcome a difficulty or obstacle
sentence: She worked hard to surmount the challenges in her science project.

definition: to support or keep something going over time
sentence: The small grant helped sustain the music program for another year.

definition: understood without being openly expressed; implied
sentence: There was a tacit agreement to keep the plan secret for now.

definition: not talkative; reserved in speech
sentence: He was taciturn in class but opened up around close friends.

definition: able to be touched or clearly understood; real
sentence: They needed tangible proof before accepting the claim.

definition: equivalent in value or effect
sentence: Her silence was tantamount to an admission of guilt.

definition: to damage the good quality or reputation of something
sentence: The scandal would tarnish the politician’s reputation for years.

definition: only slightly warm or showing little enthusiasm
sentence: The audience gave a tepid response to the new song.

definition: able to be defended or maintained against attack or objection
sentence: Her argument was tenable because she used solid evidence.

definition: not certain or fixed; done as a trial or experiment
sentence: They made tentative plans to meet after school, but nothing was set in stone.

definition: a long, angry speech of criticism or reprimand
sentence: The coach’s tirade shook the players into focusing on defense.

definition: a state of physical or mental inactivity; sluggishness
sentence: After lunch, a torpor fell over the study hall and few worked.

definition: a feeling of fear or anxiety about something that may happen
sentence: With trepidation, she stepped onto the stage for her solo performance.

definition: of little importance; not serious
sentence: They argued over a trivial point instead of focusing on the main issue.

definition: to shorten by cutting off a part
sentence: The editor had to truncate the article to fit the magazine’s space.

definition: a loud, confused noise, especially from a crowd; chaos
sentence: A tumult broke out when the popular band took the stage unexpectedly.

definition: very excited or upset; marked by disturbance
sentence: The turbulent waters made it impossible to continue the swim meet.

definition: present or found everywhere
sentence: Smartphones are ubiquitous in school hallways today.

definition: a final demand or statement of terms, the rejection of which may lead to consequences
sentence: The club gave an ultimatum: practice or you can’t play in the game.

definition: in complete agreement with no opposing votes
sentence: The decision to cancel the event was unanimous among the committee.

definition: excessively flattering or oily in manner; insincere
sentence: His unctuous compliments felt fake and made her uncomfortable.

definition: to weaken or damage something gradually
sentence: Spreading false rumors can undermine people’s trust in each other.

definition: to move in waves or with a smooth wavelike motion
sentence: The fields of grain seemed to undulate in the wind.

definition: clear and leaving no doubt; unambiguous
sentence: The teacher gave an unequivocal answer to the cheating question.
